fields.name: createCalculation
fields.description:
Add an calculation.

Example:
```
mutation{
  createCalculation (
    calculation: {
      displayHint: "$"
      expression: "total_cost"
      personalResultsTitle: ""
      public: "true"
      slug: "total-cost"
      sort: 1
      title: "Total Cost"
    }
    decisionId: 1
  ) {
    decisionId
    displayHint
    expression
    id
    insertedAt
    personalResultsTitle
    public
    slug
    sort
    title
    updatedAt
  }
}
```

returns
```
{
  "data": {
    "createCalculation": {
      "decisionId": "1",
      "displayHint": "$",
      "expression": "total_cost",
      "id": "1",
      "insertedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "personalResultsTitle": "",
      "public": "true",
      "slug": "total-cost",
      "sort": "1",
      "title": "Total Cost",
      "updatedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00"
```
```
    }
  }
}
```

types.name: ConstraintOperators

enumValues.name: BETWEEN
enumValues.description: Calculated value must be greater than or equal to (>=) the lower bound, and less than or equal to (<=) the upper bound.

enumValues.name: EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Calculated value must be equal to (=) the boundary value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Calculated value must be greater than or equal to (>=) the boundary value.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Calculated value must be less than or equal to (<=) the boundary value.

types.description: Comparison to support. Allowed values: equal_to, greater_than_or_equal_to, less_than_or_equal_to and between

types.name: CreateCriteriaParams

inputFields.name: applyParticipantWeights
inputFields.description: A boolean indicating if participant weighting should be applied to this OptionCategory

inputFields.name: bins
inputFields.description:
The number of vote increments to allow, between one and nine.

These will correspond to the number of buttons or inputs on the presentation layer. While the actual interface is up to the presentation layer, we recommend using a Likert Scale.

For example, if a Criteria has 5 bins, then presentation layer could show 5 buttons:
[Strongly Disapprove] [Disapprove] [Neutral] [Approve] [Strongly Approve]

inputFields.name: decisionId
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for the Decision the criteria belongs to. All Criterias are associated with a single Decision.

inputFields.name: deleted
inputFields.description: Object is flagged to delete on publish (soft delete)

inputFields.name: info
inputFields.description: Informative text describing the Criteira.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: The sort order for display

inputFields.name: supportOnly
inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the criteria should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo calculation takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many people are "for" or "against" an option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - people who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Name of Criteria. Used to generate slug if none supplied

inputFields.name: weighting
inputFields.description: Multiplier for a Decision-wide weighting to all votes to this Criteria. Participant specific weightings can also be entered.

types.description:
Add an criteria.

Example:
```
mutation{
  createCriteria (
    criteria: {
      bins: 5
      info: "Is this a good value?"
      slug: "value"
      sort: 1
      supportOnly: "false"
      title: "Value"
      weighting: 10
    }
    decisionId: 1
  ) {
    applyParticipantWeights
    bins
    decisionId
    deleted
    id
    info
    insertedAt
    slug
    sort
    supportOnly
    title
    updatedAt
    weighting
  }
}
```

returns
```
{
  "data": {
    "createCriteria": {
      "applyParticipantWeights": "true",
      "bins": "5",
      "decisionId": "1",
      "deleted": "false",
      "id": "1",
      "info": "Is this a good value?",
      "insertedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "slug": "value",
      "sort": "1",
      "supportOnly": "false",
      "title": "Value",
      "updatedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "weighting": "10"
    }
  }
}
```

types.name: CreateOptionCategoryParams

inputFields.name: applyParticipantWeights
inputFields.description: A boolean indicating if participant weighting should be applied to this OptionCategory

inputFields.name: budgetPercent
inputFields.description: The % amount of the total budget this category represents. Used to calculate tax assessment values.

inputFields.name: decisionId
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for the Decision the OptionCategory belongs to. All OptionCategories are associated with a single Decision.

inputFields.name: defaultHighOptionId
inputFields.description: The default 'high' option to use when range votes are applied. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating scenarios.

inputFields.name: defaultLowOptionId
inputFields.description: The default option to use when 'pick one' votes are applied, or the 'low' option to use when range votes are applied. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating scenarios.

inputFields.name: deleted
inputFields.description: Object is flagged to delete on publish (soft delete)

inputFields.name: flatFee
inputFields.description: The $ amount this category adds to every tax assessment. Used to calculate tax assessment values.

inputFields.name: info
inputFields.description: Informative text describing the OptionCategory.

inputFields.name: primaryDetailId
inputFields.description: The OptionDetail to use to order the options when converting OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes to BinVotes.

inputFields.name: quadratic
inputFields.description: If Quadradtic Voting should be used

inputFields.name: resultsTitle
inputFields.description: Optional alternate title to use in charts

inputFields.name: scoringMode
inputFields.description:
When OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes exist, the scoring mode is used to convert them into BinVotes.

To convert to bin votes, the options in the category are sorted by the primary_detail_id to put them in an ordered list. This list is then used to determine if an option is selected or not.


- none
  Default Value. Option Category Voting will not be applied.
- rectangle
  Selected items are assigned BinVotes at Bin 9 (highest possible), remaining Options have BinVotes at the bin 1
- triangle
  Highest BinVote is at selected item, and reduces for items farther away. The farthest ends have BinVotes in bin 1

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: The sort order for display

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Name of OptionCategory. Used to generate slug if none supplied

inputFields.name: triangleBase
inputFields.description: The width of the triangle (number of Options included) to use in triangle scoring

inputFields.name: voteOnPercent
inputFields.description: Toggle if votes are on the percentage value or the flat fee value

inputFields.name: votingStyle
inputFields.description:
This value is used to indicate which voting widget to use for this OptionCategory on the frontend. This is only applied when using triangle or rectangle voting modes. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating scenarios.


- range
  Display a voting widget that allows input of both a 'high' and a 'low' option. Votes will be applied to all items in the range. 
- one
  Display a voting widget that allows input of a single option.

inputFields.name: weighting
inputFields.description: Multiplier for a Decision-wide weighting to all votes to Options in the OptionCategory. Participant specific weightings can also be entered through OptionCategoryWeights.

inputFields.name: xor
inputFields.description: A boolean indicating if this optionCategory should have an XOR constraint applied (only one Option in the OptionCategory can be chosen in the solution. This constraint will not show when querying other constraints. )

types.name: CreateOptionDetailParams

inputFields.name: decisionId
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for the Decision the OptionDetail belongs to. All OptionDetails are associated with a single Decision.

inputFields.name: displayHint
inputFields.description:
An optional string that can be used to trigger display code on the presentation layer.

For example, a hint of "Dollars" or "Money" could be added to an OptionDetail to let the presentation layer know to format it as $x.xx
It is up to the presentation layer to render or parse this field. The Ethelo engine does not use this value.

inputFields.name: format
inputFields.description:
Each detail must have a format.

Choosing a format DOES NOT add validation to the user's input. Format settings are used to identify what
valid Variables and OptionFilters can be configured.
Invalid values WILL NOT be included when calculations are run.


- string
  Default Value. Data should be interpreted as text. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.
- integer
  Data should be interpreted as an integer (no decimals). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- float
  Data should be interpreted as a float/decimal. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- boolean
  Data should be interpreted as a boolean (true/false). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for "true" and "false" matches
- datetime
  Data should be interpreted a date with time. OptionFilter and Filter Variables can be configured for various time parts (Year, Month, ...)

inputFields.name: inputHint
inputFields.description:
An optional string that can be used to provide guidance on how to fill out an OptionDetail on the presentation layer.

For example, a hint of "YYYY-MM-DD" could be added to an OptionDetail to let the admin user setting up Options know the preferred format for dates.
It is up to the presentation layer to render or parse this field. The Ethelo engine does not use this value.

inputFields.name: public
inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the OptionDetail is appropriate to display to participants.

It is up to the presentation layer to display or hide OptionDetails based on this field.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: The sort order for display

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Name of OptionDetail. Used to generate slug if none supplied

```
      slug: "large-pizza-cost"

      title: "Large Pizza Cost"

  ) {
```

types.name: CreateScenarioConfigParams

inputFields.name: bins
inputFields.description:
The number of vote increments to allow, between one and nine.

These will correspond to the number of buttons or inputs on the presentation layer. While the actual interface is up to the presentation layer, we recommend using a Likert Scale.

For example, if an ScenarioConfig has 5 bins, then presentation layer could show 5 buttons:
[Strongly Disapprove] [Disapprove] [Neutral] [Approve] [Strongly Approve]

inputFields.name: collectiveIdentity
inputFields.description:
≡  = Collective Identity
Unity has a different relevance in different decision contexts because the phenomenon in which a decision becomes more powerful through unity is a social phenomenon; it doesn’t appear if there is only one participant.

For example, in a process where participants do not have relationships or the sense of reciprocity that arises in community, it may not be important that participants experience similar levels of support for an solutions, or feel that influence in shaping the solutionss was distributed fairly. However, in a stakeholder process where there are entitlements resting on a collective identity, then fairness in support distribution can be quite important. ≡ represents the importance of unity in a specific decision context.

Collective Identity (≡) determines the impact of Unity on a decision. The higher the Collective Identity value, the more important it is that the selected solutionss have similar levels of support across participants.

inputFields.name: decisionId
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for the Decision the ScenarioConfig belongs to. All ScenarioConfigs are associated with a single Decision.

inputFields.name: enabled
inputFields.description: A boolean that indicates if the ScenarioConfig is the setting currently being used. Only one ScenarioConfig will ever be enabled at a time.

inputFields.name: engineTimeout
inputFields.description: Max amount of time in millisections to allow engine to run.

inputFields.name: maxScenarios
inputFields.description: The maximum number of solutions to generate. The actual number of solutions returned cannot be guaranteed.

inputFields.name: normalizeInfluents
inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates whether participant scores should be normalized.

Normalization of scores means adjusting values measured on different scales to a notionally common scale.

inputFields.name: normalizeSatisfaction
inputFields.description: A boolean that indicates whether satisfaction scores should be normalized between the actual minimum and maximum scores possible.

inputFields.name: perOptionSatisfaction
inputFields.description: A boolean flag that controls whether or not the Ethelo engine divides satisfaction scores by the number of selected options in the scenario.

inputFields.name: quadratic
inputFields.description: If quadratic analysis should be run

inputFields.name: skipSolver
inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates whether or not to skip invoking the solver on the decision when generating scenarios.

If enabled only the global "all options" scenario will be generated and added to the resulting scenario set.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.

inputFields.name: solveInterval
inputFields.description: The length of time in milliseconds to wait between solver invocations.

inputFields.name: supportOnly
inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the scenario_config should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo calculation takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many people are "for" or "against" an option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - people who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

inputFields.name: tippingPoint
inputFields.description: As consensus for a solution decreases, there will be a “tipping point” when people will cease to resist the solutions because of inequality aversion, and begin to support it due to fairness and the unity it creates. Where this neutral tipping point is found will depend on the type of decision process and group dynamics.  By default, we set the tipping point at about 1/3rds consensus.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Name of ScenarioConfig. Used to generate slug if none supplied

inputFields.name: ttl
inputFields.description: The length of time in seconds to wait before discarding results generated with this config. Defaults to 0, or 'Never', which will grow the database very quickly.

types.description:

```
mutation{

      }

  ) {

    normalizeSatisfaction

}
```

fields.name: bins
fields.description:
The number of vote increments to allow, between one and nine.

These will correspond to the number of buttons or inputs on the presentation layer. While the actual interface is up to the presentation layer, we recommend using a Likert Scale.

For example, if a Criteria has 5 bins, then presentation layer could show 5 buttons:
[Strongly Disapprove] [Disapprove] [Neutral] [Approve] [Strongly Approve]

fields.name: supportOnly
fields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the criteria should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo calculation takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many people are "for" or "against" an option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - people who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

args.name: enabled

A boolean that indicates if the Option should be included in the Ethelo calculation. Defaults to "true".

This is a convenience setting to allow you to quickly iterate on a Decision setup without having to recreate Options.

args.name: optionCategoryId

args.name: optionFilterId
args.description:
OptionFilters can be used to select a group of Options according to their OptionDetailValues or their OptionCategory.
    These groups of Options can be used to apply constraints to a subset of Options.
    They can also be used by the presentation layer to display related options together.

    The decision will always have an "All Options" Filter defined. This OptionFilter cannot be deleted,
    and will be used as the default OptionFilter for Calculations and Constraints. The match_mode for this special OptionFilter will be "all_options".

    The system can suggest common OptionFilters that could be used to match OptionDetailValues or OptionCategories.
    These can be used to quickly create OptionFilters.

enumValues.description: Matches all Options with an OptionDetailValue matching the supplied matchValue and OptionDetail.

types.description:
Type of match to support. For OptionCategories, in category (`in_category`) and not in category (`not_in_category`) is supported.

 For most OptionDetails, only an exact match (`equals`) is supported.

types.name: DetailFormat

enumValues.name: BOOLEAN
enumValues.description: Data should be interpreted as a boolean (true/false). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for "true" and "false" matches

enumValues.name: DATETIME
enumValues.description: Data should be interpreted a date with time. OptionFilter and Filter Variables can be configured for various time parts (Year, Month, ...)

enumValues.name: FLOAT
enumValues.description: Data should be interpreted as a float/decimal. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.

enumValues.name: INTEGER
enumValues.description: Data should be interpreted as an integer (no decimals). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.

enumValues.name: STRING
enumValues.description: Default Value. Data should be interpreted as text. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.

types.description:
Each detail must have a format.

Choosing a format DOES NOT add validation to the user's input. Format settings are used to identify what
valid Variables and OptionFilters can be configured.
Invalid values WILL NOT be included when calculations are run.

types.name: Int
types.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values.
Int can represent values between `-(2^53 - 1)` and `2^53 - 1` since it is
represented in JSON as double-precision floating point numbers specified
by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: scoringMode
fields.description:
When OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes exist, the scoring mode is used to convert them into BinVotes.

To convert to bin votes, the options in the category are sorted by the primary_detail_id to put them in an ordered list. This list is then used to determine if an option is selected or not.


- none
  Default Value. Option Category Voting will not be applied.
- rectangle
  Selected items are assigned BinVotes at Bin 9 (highest possible), remaining Options have BinVotes at the bin 1
- triangle
  Highest BinVote is at selected item, and reduces for items farther away. The farthest ends have BinVotes in bin 1

Example:
```
mutation{
  createOptionCategory (
    decisionId: 1
    optionCategory: {
      budgetPercent: ""
      flatFee: ""

      voteOnPercent: "true"
      weighting: ""

    budgetPercent
    decisionId
    defaultHighOptionId
    defaultLowOptionId
    deleted
    flatFee
    id
    info
    insertedAt
    primaryDetailId
    quadratic
    resultsTitle
    scoringMode
    slug
    title
    triangleBase
    updatedAt
    voteOnPercent
    votingStyle
    weighting

}
```

fields.name: displayHint
fields.description:
An optional string that can be used to trigger display code on the presentation layer.

For example, a hint of "Dollars" or "Money" could be added to an OptionDetail to let the presentation layer know to format it as $x.xx
It is up to the presentation layer to render or parse this field. The Ethelo engine does not use this value.

fields.name: format
fields.description:
Each detail must have a format.

Choosing a format DOES NOT add validation to the user's input. Format settings are used to identify what
valid Variables and OptionFilters can be configured.
Invalid values WILL NOT be included when calculations are run.


- string
  Default Value. Data should be interpreted as text. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.
- integer
  Data should be interpreted as an integer (no decimals). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- float
  Data should be interpreted as a float/decimal. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- boolean
  Data should be interpreted as a boolean (true/false). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for "true" and "false" matches
- datetime
  Data should be interpreted a date with time. OptionFilter and Filter Variables can be configured for various time parts (Year, Month, ...)

types.description:
Option details allow configuration of arbitrary data to be added to each Option.

After an OptionDetail is defined, you can insert specific OptionDetailValues for each Option you create.
Specifying values has several uses:

- OptionDetailValues are easily listed for display or comparison
- some OptionDetailValues (like numbers) allow you to add variables to your Decision. Variables allow you to perform math on your Decision - for example to calculate total cost.

enumValues.name: ALL_OPTIONS
enumValues.description: Matches all Options.

enumValues.name: EQUALS
enumValues.description: Matches all Options with an OptionDetailValue matching the supplied matchValue and OptionDetail.

enumValues.name: IN_CATEGORY
enumValues.description: Matches all Options in the associated Option Category.

enumValues.name: NOT_IN_CATEGORY
enumValues.description: Matches all Options not in the associated Option Category.

types.description:
Type of match to support. For OptionCategories, in category (`in_category`) and not in category (`not_in_category`) is supported.

 For most OptionDetails, only an exact match (`equals`) is supported.

fields.name: matchMode
fields.description:
Type of match to support. For OptionCategories, in category (`in_category`) and not in category (`not_in_category`) is supported.

 For most OptionDetails, only an exact match (`equals`) is supported.

fields.name: matchValue
fields.description: The value to match against. If an invalid or nonexistant value is used, the OptionFilter will match no Options. Empty strings are allowed. Will be empty when matching all Options or matching an OptionCategory.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Name of OptionFilter. Used to generate slug if none supplied

args.name: enabled
args.description:
A boolean that indicates if the Option should be included in the Ethelo calculation. Defaults to "true".

This is a convenience setting to allow you to quickly iterate on a Decision setup without having to recreate Options.

args.name: optionCategoryId
args.description: The OptionCategory to source the value from. Options must define an OptionCategory.

args.name: optionFilterId
args.description:
OptionFilters can be used to select a group of Options according to their OptionDetailValues or their OptionCategory.
    These groups of Options can be used to apply constraints to a subset of Options.
    They can also be used by the presentation layer to display related options together.

    The decision will always have an "All Options" Filter defined. This OptionFilter cannot be deleted,
    and will be used as the default OptionFilter for Calculations and Constraints. The match_mode for this special OptionFilter will be "all_options".

    The system can suggest common OptionFilters that could be used to match OptionDetailValues or OptionCategories.
    These can be used to quickly create OptionFilters.

fields.name: minimize
fields.description: Whether or not to minimize the Ethelo function rather than maximize it. When the function is minimized, the 'worst' scenarios will be selected.

fields.name: status
fields.description: A string describing whether or not the solver was able to obtain a solution for the decision.

fields.name: tippingPoint
fields.description: The dissonance at which people will cease to resist the outcome because of inequality aversion, and begin to support it due to fairness and the unity it creates.

types.description: A solution to a decision.

fields.name: bins
fields.description:
The number of vote increments to allow, between one and nine.

These will correspond to the number of buttons or inputs on the presentation layer. While the actual interface is up to the presentation layer, we recommend using a Likert Scale.

For example, if an ScenarioConfig has 5 bins, then presentation layer could show 5 buttons:
[Strongly Disapprove] [Disapprove] [Neutral] [Approve] [Strongly Approve]

fields.name: collectiveIdentity
fields.description:
≡  = Collective Identity
Unity has a different relevance in different decision contexts because the phenomenon in which a decision becomes more powerful through unity is a social phenomenon; it doesn’t appear if there is only one participant.

For example, in a process where participants do not have relationships or the sense of reciprocity that arises in community, it may not be important that participants experience similar levels of support for an solutions, or feel that influence in shaping the solutionss was distributed fairly. However, in a stakeholder process where there are entitlements resting on a collective identity, then fairness in support distribution can be quite important. ≡ represents the importance of unity in a specific decision context.

Collective Identity (≡) determines the impact of Unity on a decision. The higher the Collective Identity value, the more important it is that the selected solutionss have similar levels of support across participants.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: A boolean that indicates if the ScenarioConfig is the setting currently being used. Only one ScenarioConfig will ever be enabled at a time.

fields.name: engineTimeout
fields.description: Max amount of time in millisections to allow engine to run.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier.

fields.name: insertedAt
fields.description: Date/time item was created.

fields.name: maxScenarios
fields.description: The maximum number of solutions to generate. The actual number of solutions returned cannot be guaranteed.

fields.name: normalizeInfluents
fields.description:
A boolean that indicates whether participant scores should be normalized.

Normalization of scores means adjusting values measured on different scales to a notionally common scale.

fields.name: normalizeSatisfaction
fields.description: A boolean that indicates whether satisfaction scores should be normalized between the actual minimum and maximum scores possible.

fields.name: perOptionSatisfaction
fields.description: A boolean flag that controls whether or not the Ethelo engine divides satisfaction scores by the number of selected options in the scenario.

fields.name: quadratic
fields.description: If quadratic analysis should be run

fields.name: skipSolver
fields.description:
A boolean that indicates whether or not to skip invoking the solver on the decision when generating scenarios.

If enabled only the global "all options" scenario will be generated and added to the resulting scenario set.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.

fields.name: solveInterval
fields.description: The length of time in milliseconds to wait between solver invocations.

fields.name: supportOnly
fields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the scenario_config should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo calculation takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many people are "for" or "against" an option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - people who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

fields.name: tippingPoint
fields.description: As consensus for a solution decreases, there will be a “tipping point” when people will cease to resist the solutions because of inequality aversion, and begin to support it due to fairness and the unity it creates. Where this neutral tipping point is found will depend on the type of decision process and group dynamics.  By default, we set the tipping point at about 1/3rds consensus.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Name of ScenarioConfig. Used to generate slug if none supplied

fields.name: ttl
fields.description: The length of time in seconds to wait before discarding results generated with this config. Defaults to 0, or 'Never', which will grow the database very quickly.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Date/time item was last updated.

fields.name: createScenarioConfig
fields.description:
Add an scenarioConfig.

Example:
```
mutation{
  createScenarioConfig (
    decisionId: 1
    scenarioConfig: {
      bins: 5
      ci: {
        coef: 0
        exp: -1
        sign: 1
        struct: "Elixir.Decimal"
      }
      enabled: "true"
      engineTimeout: 10000
      maxScenarios: 1
      normalizeInfluents: "false"
      normalizeSatisfaction: "true"
      perOptionSatisfaction: "false"
      quadratic: "false"
      skipSolver: "false"
      slug: "default"
      supportOnly: "false"
      tippingPoint: {
        coef: 33333
        exp: -5
        sign: 1
        struct: "Elixir.Decimal"
      }
      title: "Default"
      ttl: 0
    }
  ) {
    bins
    ci
    collectiveIdentity
    decisionId
    enabled
    engineTimeout
    id
    insertedAt
    maxScenarios
    normalizeInfluents
    normalizeSatisfaction
    perOptionSatisfaction
    quadratic
    skipSolver
    slug
    supportOnly
    tippingPoint
    title
    ttl
    updatedAt
  }
}
```

returns
```
{
  "data": {
    "createScenarioConfig": {
      "bins": "5",
      "ci": "0.0",
      "collectiveIdentity": "0.0",
      "decisionId": "1",
      "enabled": "true",
      "engineTimeout": "10000",
      "id": "1",
      "insertedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "maxScenarios": "1",
      "normalizeInfluents": "false",
      "normalizeSatisfaction": "true",
      "perOptionSatisfaction": "false",
      "quadratic": "false",
      "skipSolver": "false",
      "slug": "default",
      "supportOnly": "false",
      "tippingPoint": "0.33333",
      "title": "Default",
      "ttl": "0",
      "updatedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00"
    }
  }
}
```

fields.name: updateScenarioConfig
fields.description:
Update an existing scenarioConfig. updatedAt will be automatically updated when you make changes.

Example:
```
mutation{
  updateScenarioConfig (
    decisionId: 1
    id: 1
    scenarioConfig: {
      bins: 9
      ci: {
        coef: 5
        exp: -1
        sign: 1
        struct: "Elixir.Decimal"
      }
      enabled: "false"
      engineTimeout: 6000
      maxScenarios: 20
      normalizeInfluents: "true"
      normalizeSatisfaction: "false"
      perOptionSatisfaction: "false"
      quadratic: "true"
      skipSolver: "false"
      slug: "ci-point-five"
      supportOnly: "true"
      tippingPoint: {
        coef: 66666
        exp: -5
        sign: 1
        struct: "Elixir.Decimal"
      }
      title: "CI at 0.5"
      ttl: 10
    }
  ) {
    bins
    ci
    collectiveIdentity
    decisionId
    enabled
    engineTimeout
    id
    insertedAt
    maxScenarios
    normalizeInfluents
    normalizeSatisfaction
    perOptionSatisfaction
    quadratic
    skipSolver
    slug
    supportOnly
    tippingPoint
    title
    ttl
    updatedAt
  }
}
```

returns
```
{
  "data": {
    "updateScenarioConfig": {
      "bins": "9",
      "ci": "0.5",
      "collectiveIdentity": "0.5",
      "decisionId": "1",
      "enabled": "false",
      "engineTimeout": "6000",
      "id": "1",
      "insertedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "maxScenarios": "20",
      "normalizeInfluents": "true",
      "normalizeSatisfaction": "false",
      "perOptionSatisfaction": "false",
      "quadratic": "true",
      "skipSolver": "false",
      "slug": "ci-point-five",
      "supportOnly": "true",
      "tippingPoint": "0.66666",
      "title": "CI at 0.5",
      "ttl": "10",
      "updatedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00"
    }
  }
}
```

types.name: ScoringMode

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: Default Value. Option Category Voting will not be applied.

enumValues.name: RECTANGLE
enumValues.description: Selected items are assigned BinVotes at Bin 9 (highest possible), remaining Options have BinVotes at the bin 1

enumValues.name: TRIANGLE
enumValues.description: Highest BinVote is at selected item, and reduces for items farther away. The farthest ends have BinVotes in bin 1

types.description:
When OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes exist, the scoring mode is used to convert them into BinVotes.

To convert to bin votes, the options in the category are sorted by the primary_detail_id to put them in an ordered list. This list is then used to determine if an option is selected or not.

types.name: SingleBoundaryConstraintOperators

enumValues.name: EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Calculated value must be equal to (=) the boundary value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Calculated value must be greater than or equal to (>=) the boundary value.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Calculated value must be less than or equal to (<=) the boundary value.

types.description: Comparison to support. Allowed values: equal_to, greater_than_or_equal_to, less_than_or_equal_to and between

types.description:
Update an existing constraint. updatedAt will be automatically updated when you make changes.

Example:
```
mutation{
  updateBetweenConstraint (
    constraint: {
      betweenHigh: 3
      betweenLow: 2
      calculationId: ""
      enabled: "true"
      optionFilterId: 4
      relaxable: "true"
      slug: "2-or-3-veg"
      title: "2 or 3 Vegetarian Options"
      variableId: 5
    }
    decisionId: 1
    id: 6
  ) {
    betweenHigh
    betweenLow
    calculationId
    decisionId
    enabled
    id
    insertedAt
    operator

    relaxable
    slug
    title
    updatedAt
    variableId

}
```

An optional string that can be used to trigger display code on the presentation layer.

For example, a hint of "Dollars" or "Money" could be added to an Calculation to let the presentation layer know to format it as $x.xx
It is up to the presentation layer to render or parse this field. The Ethelo engine does not use this value.

It is up to the presentation layer to display or hide Calculations based on this field.

inputFields.name: slug

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: The sort order for display

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Name of Calculation. Used to generate slug if none supplied

types.description:
Update an existing calculation. updatedAt will be automatically updated when you make changes.

Example:
```
mutation{
  updateCalculation (
    calculation: {
      displayHint: ""
      expression: "discount * -1"
      personalResultsTitle: ""
      public: "true"
      slug: "savings"
      sort: 3
      title: "Savings"
    }
    decisionId: 1
    id: 1
  ) {
    decisionId
    displayHint
    expression
    id
    insertedAt
    personalResultsTitle
    public
    slug
    sort

    updatedAt
  }
}
```

inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the criteria should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo calculation takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many people are "for" or "against" an option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - people who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Name of Criteria. Used to generate slug if none supplied

inputFields.name: weighting
inputFields.description: Multiplier for a Decision-wide weighting to all votes to this Criteria. Participant specific weightings can also be entered.

types.description:
Update an existing criteria. updatedAt will be automatically updated when you make changes.

Example:
```
mutation{
  updateCriteria (
    criteria: {
      bins: 7
      info: "Is the price a good value?"
      slug: "price"
      sort: 4
      supportOnly: "false"
      title: "Price"
    }
    decisionId: 1
    id: 1
  ) {
    applyParticipantWeights
    bins
    decisionId
    deleted
    id
    info
    insertedAt
    slug
    sort
    supportOnly
    title
    updatedAt
    weighing
  }
}
```

returns
```
{
  "data": {
    "updateCriteria": {
      "applyParticipantWeights": "false",
      "bins": "7",
      "decisionId": "1",
      "deleted": "false",
      "id": "1",
      "info": "Is the price a good value?",
      "insertedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "slug": "price",
      "sort": "4",
      "supportOnly": "false",
      "title": "Price",
      "updatedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",
      "weighing": "23"
```
```
    }
  }
}
```

types.name: UpdateOptionCategoryParams

inputFields.name: applyParticipantWeights
inputFields.description: A boolean indicating if participant weighting should be applied to this OptionCategory

inputFields.name: budgetPercent
inputFields.description: The % amount of the total budget this category represents. Used to calculate tax assessment values.

inputFields.name: decisionId
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for the Decision the OptionCategory belongs to. All OptionCategories are associated with a single Decision.

inputFields.name: defaultHighOptionId
inputFields.description: The default 'high' option to use when range votes are applied. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating scenarios.

inputFields.name: defaultLowOptionId
inputFields.description: The default option to use when 'pick one' votes are applied, or the 'low' option to use when range votes are applied. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating scenarios.

inputFields.name: deleted
inputFields.description: Object is flagged to delete on publish (soft delete)

inputFields.name: flatFee
inputFields.description: The $ amount this category adds to every tax assessment. Used to calculate tax assessment values.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Unique identifier.

inputFields.name: info
inputFields.description: Informative text describing the OptionCategory.

inputFields.name: primaryDetailId
inputFields.description: The OptionDetail to use to order the options when converting OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes to BinVotes.

inputFields.name: quadratic
inputFields.description: If Quadradtic Voting should be used

inputFields.name: resultsTitle
inputFields.description: Optional alternate title to use in charts

inputFields.name: scoringMode
inputFields.description:
When OptionCategoryBinVotes or OptionCategoryRangeVotes exist, the scoring mode is used to convert them into BinVotes.

To convert to bin votes, the options in the category are sorted by the primary_detail_id to put them in an ordered list. This list is then used to determine if an option is selected or not.


- none
  Default Value. Option Category Voting will not be applied.
- rectangle
  Selected items are assigned BinVotes at Bin 9 (highest possible), remaining Options have BinVotes at the bin 1
- triangle
  Highest BinVote is at selected item, and reduces for items farther away. The farthest ends have BinVotes in bin 1

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: The sort order for display

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Name of OptionCategory. Used to generate slug if none supplied

inputFields.name: triangleBase
inputFields.description: The width of the triangle (number of Options included) to use in triangle scoring

inputFields.name: voteOnPercent
inputFields.description: Toggle if votes are on the percentage value or the flat fee value

inputFields.name: votingStyle
inputFields.description:
This value is used to indicate which voting widget to use for this OptionCategory on the frontend. This is only applied when using triangle or rectangle voting modes. This value only affects the frontend and is not used when calculating scenarios.


- range
  Display a voting widget that allows input of both a 'high' and a 'low' option. Votes will be applied to all items in the range. 
- one
  Display a voting widget that allows input of a single option.

inputFields.name: weighting
inputFields.description: Multiplier for a Decision-wide weighting to all votes to Options in the OptionCategory. Participant specific weightings can also be entered through OptionCategoryWeights.

inputFields.name: xor
inputFields.description: A boolean indicating if this optionCategory should have an XOR constraint applied (only one Option in the OptionCategory can be chosen in the solution. This constraint will not show when querying other constraints. )

types.name: UpdateOptionDetailParams

inputFields.name: decisionId
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for the Decision the OptionDetail belongs to. All OptionDetails are associated with a single Decision.

inputFields.name: displayHint
inputFields.description:
An optional string that can be used to trigger display code on the presentation layer.

For example, a hint of "Dollars" or "Money" could be added to an OptionDetail to let the presentation layer know to format it as $x.xx
It is up to the presentation layer to render or parse this field. The Ethelo engine does not use this value.

inputFields.name: format
inputFields.description:
Each detail must have a format.

Choosing a format DOES NOT add validation to the user's input. Format settings are used to identify what
valid Variables and OptionFilters can be configured.
Invalid values WILL NOT be included when calculations are run.


- string
  Default Value. Data should be interpreted as text. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.
- integer
  Data should be interpreted as an integer (no decimals). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- float
  Data should be interpreted as a float/decimal. OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for each unique value.. Detail Variables can be configured for sums and means.
- boolean
  Data should be interpreted as a boolean (true/false). OptionFilters and Filter Variables can be configured for "true" and "false" matches
- datetime
  Data should be interpreted a date with time. OptionFilter and Filter Variables can be configured for various time parts (Year, Month, ...)

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Unique identifier.

inputFields.name: inputHint
inputFields.description:
An optional string that can be used to provide guidance on how to fill out an OptionDetail on the presentation layer.

For example, a hint of "YYYY-MM-DD" could be added to an OptionDetail to let the admin user setting up Options know the preferred format for dates.
It is up to the presentation layer to render or parse this field. The Ethelo engine does not use this value.

inputFields.name: public
inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the OptionDetail is appropriate to display to participants.

It is up to the presentation layer to display or hide OptionDetails based on this field.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: The sort order for display

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Name of OptionDetail. Used to generate slug if none supplied

```
  ) {

}
```

types.name: UpdateParticipantParams

inputFields.name: decisionId
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for the Decision the Participant belongs to. All Participants are associated with a single Decision.

inputFields.description: Unique identifier.

inputFields.name: weighting
inputFields.description: Weighting applied to all votes from participant

types.name: UpdateScenarioConfigParams

inputFields.name: bins
inputFields.description:
The number of vote increments to allow, between one and nine.

These will correspond to the number of buttons or inputs on the presentation layer. While the actual interface is up to the presentation layer, we recommend using a Likert Scale.

For example, if an ScenarioConfig has 5 bins, then presentation layer could show 5 buttons:
[Strongly Disapprove] [Disapprove] [Neutral] [Approve] [Strongly Approve]

inputFields.name: collectiveIdentity
inputFields.description:
≡  = Collective Identity
Unity has a different relevance in different decision contexts because the phenomenon in which a decision becomes more powerful through unity is a social phenomenon; it doesn’t appear if there is only one participant.

For example, in a process where participants do not have relationships or the sense of reciprocity that arises in community, it may not be important that participants experience similar levels of support for an solutions, or feel that influence in shaping the solutionss was distributed fairly. However, in a stakeholder process where there are entitlements resting on a collective identity, then fairness in support distribution can be quite important. ≡ represents the importance of unity in a specific decision context.

Collective Identity (≡) determines the impact of Unity on a decision. The higher the Collective Identity value, the more important it is that the selected solutionss have similar levels of support across participants.

inputFields.name: decisionId
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for the Decision the ScenarioConfig belongs to. All ScenarioConfigs are associated with a single Decision.

inputFields.name: enabled
inputFields.description: A boolean that indicates if the ScenarioConfig is the setting currently being used. Only one ScenarioConfig will ever be enabled at a time.

inputFields.name: engineTimeout
inputFields.description: Max amount of time in millisections to allow engine to run.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Unique identifier.

inputFields.name: maxScenarios
inputFields.description: The maximum number of solutions to generate. The actual number of solutions returned cannot be guaranteed.

inputFields.name: normalizeInfluents
inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates whether participant scores should be normalized.

Normalization of scores means adjusting values measured on different scales to a notionally common scale.

inputFields.name: normalizeSatisfaction
inputFields.description: A boolean that indicates whether satisfaction scores should be normalized between the actual minimum and maximum scores possible.

inputFields.name: perOptionSatisfaction
inputFields.description: A boolean flag that controls whether or not the Ethelo engine divides satisfaction scores by the number of selected options in the scenario.

inputFields.name: quadratic
inputFields.description: If quadratic analysis should be run

inputFields.name: skipSolver
inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates whether or not to skip invoking the solver on the decision when generating scenarios.

If enabled only the global "all options" scenario will be generated and added to the resulting scenario set.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.

inputFields.name: solveInterval
inputFields.description: The length of time in milliseconds to wait between solver invocations.

inputFields.name: supportOnly
inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the scenario_config should not include "disapproval" values. Defaults to "false".

The Ethelo calculation takes into account how polarizing a Decision is - if many people are "for" or "against" an option, it will affect the score.

By default, the system assumes that a vote in the lower bins indicates disapproval - people who use these values are against the Option.
Bins are distributed from "Extremely Against" to "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

When "support only" is enbabled, then the assumption changes. Votes in the lower bins are instead considered neutral votes.
Bins are distributed from "Neutral" to "Extremely Support".

inputFields.name: tippingPoint
inputFields.description: As consensus for a solution decreases, there will be a “tipping point” when people will cease to resist the solutions because of inequality aversion, and begin to support it due to fairness and the unity it creates. Where this neutral tipping point is found will depend on the type of decision process and group dynamics.  By default, we set the tipping point at about 1/3rds consensus.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Name of ScenarioConfig. Used to generate slug if none supplied

inputFields.name: ttl
inputFields.description: The length of time in seconds to wait before discarding results generated with this config. Defaults to 0, or 'Never', which will grow the database very quickly.

types.description:
Update an existing scenarioConfig. updatedAt will be automatically updated when you make changes.

Example:
```
mutation{
  updateScenarioConfig (
    decisionId: 1
    id: 1
    scenarioConfig: {
      bins: 9
      ci: {
        coef: 5
        exp: -1
        sign: 1
        struct: "Elixir.Decimal"
      }
      enabled: "false"
      engineTimeout: 6000
      maxScenarios: 20
      normalizeInfluents: "true"
      normalizeSatisfaction: "false"
      perOptionSatisfaction: "false"
      quadratic: "true"
      skipSolver: "false"
      slug: "ci-point-five"
      supportOnly: "true"
      tippingPoint: {
        coef: 66666
        exp: -5
        sign: 1
        struct: "Elixir.Decimal"
      }
      title: "CI at 0.5"
      ttl: 10
    }
  ) {
    bins
    ci
    collectiveIdentity
    decisionId
    enabled
    engineTimeout
    id
    insertedAt
    maxScenarios
    normalizeInfluents
    normalizeSatisfaction
    perOptionSatisfaction
    quadratic
    skipSolver
    slug
    supportOnly
    tippingPoint
    title
    ttl
    updatedAt
  }
}
```

```
{

      "engineTimeout": "6000",
      "id": "1",
      "insertedAt": "2017-05-05T16:48:16+00:00",

      "normalizeSatisfaction": "false",
      "perOptionSatisfaction": "false",
      "quadratic": "true",
```

types.name: UpdateSingleBoundaryConstraintParams

inputFields.name: calculationId
inputFields.description: The Calculation compare to. Constraints must define either a Variable or a Calculation.

inputFields.name: decisionId
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for the Decision the Constraint belongs to. All Constraints are associated with a single Decision.

inputFields.name: enabled
inputFields.description:
A boolean that indicates if the Constraint should be included in the Ethelo calculation. Defaults to "true".

This is a convenience setting to allow you to quickly iterate on a Decision setup without having to recreate Constraints.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Unique identifier.

inputFields.name: operator
inputFields.description: Comparison to support. Allowed values: equal_to, greater_than_or_equal_to, less_than_or_equal_to and between

inputFields.name: optionFilterId
inputFields.description: The Calculation compare to. Constraints must define either a Variable or a Calculation.

inputFields.name: relaxable
inputFields.description: Indicates if the constraint can be ignored if necessary to get a result

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: A memorable and communicatable id. Suitable for use in a url. Will be generated automatically from title if empty or not supplied.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Name of Constraint. Used to generate slug if none supplied

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: Boundary for a single value constraint (all operators except between). Will be null for between constraints.

inputFields.name: variableId
inputFields.description: The Calculation compare to. Constraints must define either a Variable or a Calculation.

```
}
```

types.name: ValidationMessage

fields.name: code
fields.description:
A unique error code for the type of validation used.

    TODO: Add list

fields.name: field
fields.description:
The input field that the error applies to. The field can be used to
    identify which field the error message should be displayed next to in the
    presentation layer.

    If there are multiple errors to display for a field, multiple validation
    messages will be in the result.

    This field may be null in cases where an error cannot be applied to a specific field.

fields.name: message
fields.description:
A friendly error message, appropriate for display to the end user.

    The message is interpolated to include the appropriate variables.

    Example: `Username must be at least 10 characters`

    This message may change without notice, so we do not recommend you match against the text.
    Instead, use the *code* field for matching.

fields.name: options
fields.description: A list of substitutions to be applied to a validation message template

fields.name: template
fields.description:
A template used to generate the error message, with placeholders for option substiution.

    Example: `Username must be at least {count} characters`

    This message may change without notice, so we do not recommend you match against the text.
    Instead, use the *code* field for matching.

types.description:
Validation messages are returned when mutation input does not meet the requirements.
  While client-side validation is highly recommended to provide the best User Experience,
  All inputs will always be validated server-side.

  Some examples of validations are:

  * Username must be at least 10 characters
  * Email field does not contain an email address
  * Birth Date is required

  While GraphQL has support for required values, mutation data fields are always
  set to optional in our API. This allows 'required field' messages
  to be returned in the same manner as other validations. The only exceptions
  are id fields, which may be required to perform updates or deletes.
